result.execSummary:
The defendant Juaquin Barroso Quevedo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs to be paid as a Condition of Probation. DNA surcharge is WAIVED.
Defendant MAY do Community Service at the rate of $10.00 an hour to pay for the costs during the probation time.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with the victim.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juaquin Barroso Quevedo in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Edward M Bremberger and Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Case called for sentencing hearing. State presents arguments. Defense presents arguments. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

30 days jail straight time as to each count, consecutive

TERM OF PROBATION:   1 YEAR

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*No contact with the victim
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
COURT COSTS:  $243.00 on each count (to be paid as a condition of probation);
DRGOD Surcharge $10.00 on count 2
DNA SURCHARGE:   is waived

Defendant may do community service at the rate of $10 a hour to pay for the costs during the probation time.

Defendant Juaquin Barroso Quevedo in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter. Defendant needs more time to complete his counseling and defense is requesting a new sentencing date. Court grants.   Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Juaquin Barroso Quevedo in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Patrick Ryan appeared as interpreter.  Defendant pleads no contest to Count 2 and guilty to Count 3.  Count 1 is dismissed and read-in. Defense is requesting a separate sentencing date.    Interpreter available for next scheduled hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
